question: Question_02_(a)
statement:
Let

\[A=\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0&-2 \\ 
1& 1 & 0\\ 
0&-2 & h
\end{bmatrix}.\]

Find all values of h such that A is NOT invertible.
sols:
The matrix is NOT invertible if its determinant is equal to 0.

$0 =\text{det}(A) = (1)\begin{bmatrix}1 &0 \\ -2&h \end{bmatrix}+ (-0)\begin{bmatrix}1 &0 \\ 0&h \end{bmatrix} + (-2)\begin{bmatrix}1 &1 \\ 0&-2 \end{bmatrix} = h - 2(-2) = h + 4$

Therefore $\displaystyle h = -4$ makes the matrix \emph{A} NOT
invertible
